NAME: Circle
DESCRIPTION: Ah, the classic circle, formed by the congregation of all the points in a plane equidistant from a center.

NAME: Cone
DESCRIPTION: Often used to serve ice cream, direct traffic, set boundaries for a sports game, etc.

NAME: Cylinder
DESCRIPTION: Appears in a lot of 3D math problems, and often confused with a cone... or is it just me?

NAME: Ellipse
DESCRIPTION: "It's an ELLIPSE, not an OVAL."

NAME: Hexagon
DESCRIPTION: Bees know what's up.

NAME: Icosagon
DESCRIPTION: I bet you never heard of this one. Looks awfully similar to a circle... probably because of its 20 sides.

NAME: Line
DESCRIPTION: y=mx+b

NAME: Octagon
DESCRIPTION: Remember to come to a complete stop!

NAME: Pentagon
DESCRIPTION: It's cool how they named a shape after The Pentagon.

NAME: Point
DESCRIPTION: Dot.

NAME: Sphere
DESCRIPTION: Ah, the classic sphere, formed by the congregation of all the points in 3D space equidistant from a center.

NAME: Square Pyramid
DESCRIPTION: Have you been to Egypt?

NAME: Square
DESCRIPTION: A very special rectangle. Or just a pointy circle.

NAME: Torus
DESCRIPTION: Doughnuts, doughnuts, doughnuts.

NAME: Trapezoid
DESCRIPTION: Wait, a rectangle is a trapezoid too?

NAME: Triangle
DESCRIPTION: Perhaps the most commonly used shape to solve geometry problems in math contests.

NAME: Triangular Prism
DESCRIPTION: Often looks like a tent, or those Toblerone chocolate bars.

NAME: Tesseract
DESCRIPTION: You have entered 4D. Congratulations.

NAME: Apeirogon
DESCRIPTION: The infinite polygon. Congratulations.

DESCRIPTION: CW or CCW? Congratulations.

NAME: Ellipsoid
DESCRIPTION: "It's an ELLIPSOID, not an OVOID."

NAME: Enneadecagon
DESCRIPTION: I bet you never heard of this one. Looks awfully similar to a circle... probably because of its 19 sides.

NAME: Pentagonal Prism
DESCRIPTION: Looks like The Pentagon.
